## Factors that influence the efficieny of AP
   - Age, gender, smoking <br> <br />
   - Genotype - i.e. metabolic enzymes <br> <br />
   - Polypharmacy <br> <br />
   - Time of day of administration <br> <br />
   
---
## The factors that influence the efficiency of AP also influence DNA methylation levels seen in peripheral blood.

Hypothesis: We hypothisize that differential DNA methylation associated with 
AP drugs identified in the peripheral blood of individuals taking these drugs, independent of diagnosis

## TOP Cohort

Considerations when teasing out medication effects on DNAm. <br> <br />
   - Polypharmacy <br> <br />
   - Small sample size for monotherapy <br> <br />
   - Missing values <br> <br />
   - Study design <br> <br />
   
---
## Study design 

.enlarge[New approaches:

   - Evaluate serum values (van Dongen) <br> <br />
   - Evaluate AP/serum values as one phenotype and do not correct for              cell-type proportions (Greally & Lappalainen)

   - Diagnosis & health status <br> <br />

### Models selected for Quetiapine n=92 <br> <br> <br/>

.enlarge[Mod1: DNAm ~ Serum1 + Serum2 + Serum_Lithium + Age + Sex + SmokingScore] <br> <br />

.enlarge[Mod2: DNAm ~ Serum1 + Serum2 + Serum_Lithium + Age + Sex + SmokingScore + <br> <br /> Mono + Neu + NK + CD4T + CD8T + Bcells]
